name: places/ChIJYRKHyCdbwokRjoNxBZ2DHv4
formattedAddress: 16 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004, USA
adrFormatAddress: 16 Beaver St, New York, NY 10004-2314, USA

originalText.text:
I went here for the first time with my roommate as a Christmas gift for each other. We booked the Italian Dinner w/ Tiramisu and it was so much fun! We sat in tables with other guests and usually partnered in 2’s or 4’s to cook the food. The food you cook ends up being for the whole group except the Tiramisu. Most of the ingredients are prepped ahead of time and they prepared the pasta sauces, salad and chicken. The rest is very hands on though so you still learn a lot. We loved all the dishes and it was so delicious!

They also provided sparking water, soft drinks, wine, cold cuts, cheese and crackers! It was a nice surprise since we were confused if it was BYOB or not. Also really enjoyed chatting with the folks at our table.

Chef Y was the best instructor I’ve had and I’ve done a couple of cooking classes at other places. He had so much knowledge to share and I appreciated him explaining the cooking process. He was great at hosting a room full of so many people too! Very interactive and attentive.

Great place to come with your partner, friend or even yourself! Amazing gift idea too. 10/10 food and experience!

originalText.text:
Spent years putting off the chance to cook pasta from scratch. SelfUp helped me conquer my fears of artistically converting dough to comfort foods. This class experience was so sublime when it came down to helping beginner cooks and aspiring chefs. The chef in charge of our class that day was Chef Danny and loved his shared Italian recipes and the humor brought to the whole cooking experience.

We had fun making a whole Italian meal: from Tiramisu (dessert goes first because it needs time to be chilled), Chicken Marsala, Creme Fraiche Ravioli, Mozzarella cheese, and Alfredo Fetticine. There’s no better joy than tasting pasta and cheese from scratch and right after the cooking process. Every piece of food was broken down so simply and it made my friend and I forget how intimidating the cooking process can be. My only regret was not taking pictures of the pasta sheet ribbon train because that was pretty impressive to witness when evenly cutting up the pasta strands.

Hats off to the chef, Vergine and the rest of the SelfUp team. Super excited to come back and take on other cooking classes for sure.

originalText.text: Our company recently hosted a teambuilding exercise here, and were extremely happy with the experience, the chef and support staff, and the quality of food! Highly recommend to anybody considering, bringing a group and highly recommend the Italian meal.

text.text: Our company recently hosted a teambuilding exercise here, and were extremely happy with the experience, the chef and support staff, and the quality of food! Highly recommend to anybody considering, bringing a group and highly recommend the Italian meal.

originalText.text: This cooking class was fun and the food was delicious! The event was perfect for the small bachelorette group that I went with last weekend. Chef Danny and everyone who worked there was friendly, explained all the processes, and gave helpful cooking tips. I enjoyed meeting other people at the class and being put into groups to work together. We were busy working and cooking but also had down time to sit, drink wine, and talk. I’d recommend this class as a date night or for a group of friends!

originalText.text: Self Up Cooking Classes exceeded my expectations! The instructors were knowledgeable, fun and patient, creating a relaxed atmosphere. I learned new techniques and delicious recipes. The hands-on experience was invaluable. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a team event in NYC!
